description: Export GDD sections to a formatted Word document
input: Export the Combat Mechanics and Economy sections of the GDD into a professional Word document with table of contents, version history, and proper formatting.
expected_behavior: Produces a .docx file with cover page, auto-generated TOC, properly styled headings, status indicators (color-coded), version history table, and page numbers. Content is pulled from GDD sections.
rubric: Document has cover page and TOC
Heading hierarchy is correct (H1, H2, H3)
Status indicators present with color coding
Version history included
Professional formatting suitable for stakeholders

description: Generate an executive summary of the GDD
input: Write a 2-page executive summary of the entire GDD for a publisher meeting. Focus on what makes Infinite Voyage unique and the current development status.
expected_behavior: Produces a concise executive summary covering vision, key differentiators, development status, and next milestones. Written for a non-technical audience. Professional tone.
rubric: Fits within 2 pages
Covers vision, differentiators, and status
Written for non-technical audience
Professional tone appropriate for publishers
Highlights what makes the game unique

description: Format a raw design document into GDD standard
input: Here are my rough notes about the crafting system. Can you format them into a proper GDD section following our templates?
expected_behavior: Takes informal notes and restructures them into the standard section template (section-template.md format). Adds missing fields, flags incomplete areas, and applies consistent formatting.
rubric: Follows section-template.md structure
All required fields present or flagged as missing
Technical parameters extracted into tables
Dependencies section populated
Open questions identified

description: Plan full document structure from GDD index before writing
input: I have our complete GDD index (see gdd-index-complete.json with all 12 sections). Before we start writing the compiled document, create a full document plan that maps each index entry to its place in the final Word doc, identifies page-break points, estimates page counts, and flags sections that are still Concept-only so we know where placeholder pages are needed.
expected_behavior: Produces a document plan that lists every section from the 12-chapter index in output order, assigns heading levels (H1/H2/H3), marks page-break boundaries between chapters, estimates per-section page counts, and highlights Concept-status sections as needing placeholder treatment. Includes front matter (cover, executive summary, TOC) and back matter (appendices, change log, approvals) in the plan.
rubric: All 12 chapters and their subsections appear in the plan in correct order
Front matter (cover, executive summary, quick facts, TOC) and back matter (appendices, change log, approvals) are included
Page-break points are marked between major chapters
Concept-status sections are flagged as placeholders requiring special treatment
Estimated page counts are provided per section and as a document total

description: Produce v1.1 document with change log and revised-section markers
input: We need to publish GDD v1.1. Using the change log (gdd-v1-changelog.md), produce the updated document. Every section that changed should have a visible "REVISED in v1.1" marker next to its heading. Include the full change log as an appendix and update the cover page version number and date.
expected_behavior: Generates a v1.1 document where the cover page shows version 1.1 with the current date. Sections listed in the change log (2.3, 3.2, 3.4, 6.2, 6.4, 9.1, 9.2, 12.2) have a visible revision marker. New sections (9.1, 9.2) are marked as new additions. The change log appendix reproduces all changes with type, author, and details. Unchanged sections remain unmarked.
rubric: Cover page version reads 1.1 with updated date
All 8 changed sections have a visible "REVISED in v1.1" marker adjacent to the heading
New sections (9.1, 9.2) are distinguished from revised sections with "NEW in v1.1" markers
Change log appendix lists every change with section number, type, author, and bullet-point details
Sections not in the change log remain clean with no revision markers

description: Generate glossary appendix from game-specific terms across all sections
input: Here is a raw list of terms collected from every section of the Infinite Voyage GDD (see gdd-terms-list.md). Generate a formatted Glossary appendix. Each term should have a concise definition written for someone new to the project. Group terms by category and sort alphabetically within each group.
expected_behavior: Produces a Glossary appendix with terms organized by category (World & Setting, Gameplay & Mechanics, Ship & Navigation, Economy & Resources, Narrative & Characters, Combat, Technical, Project Management). Each term has a 1-3 sentence definition that is accurate to Infinite Voyage's sci-fi setting and game mechanics. Terms are alphabetically sorted within their category. The appendix follows professional document formatting with clear headers.
rubric: All terms from every category in the raw list are present in the glossary
Definitions are concise (1-3 sentences) and accurate to the Infinite Voyage setting and mechanics
Terms are grouped by category with clear section headers matching the source categories
Terms are alphabetically sorted within each category group
Formatting is professional with consistent style suitable for inclusion as a GDD appendix

description: Generate section status summary page with color-coded table
input: Using the section status data (section-status-data.json), generate a one-page status summary dashboard for our weekly leads meeting. Show a table with section number, title, status (color-coded: green=Final, blue=Review, orange=Draft, red=Concept), owner, last updated date, and any notes. Include a summary bar at the top showing the count and percentage of sections in each status.
expected_behavior: Produces a single-page status dashboard with a summary bar showing counts (e.g., Final: 9, Review: 14, Draft: 18, Concept: 17) and percentages. Below it, a table lists every section with color-coded status cells. The table is sorted by section number. Sections with notes display them in a final column. The page header identifies the document version (1.1) and snapshot date.
rubric: Summary bar at the top shows accurate counts and percentages for each status category
Table includes all sections from the input data with correct number, title, status, owner, and date
Status cells are color-coded according to the legend (green, blue, orange, red)
Sections with non-empty notes display them visibly in the table
Page header shows document version 1.1 and snapshot date 2026-02-10
